lead_paragraph: Edward Beloyianis was paralyzed at 14 as a result of a spinal operation at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center. He died eight years later of complications of the paralysis.

headline.print_headline: Jury Awards $45 Million for a Death After Surgery
headline.main: Jury in the Bronx Awards $45 Million for a Death After Surgery

snippet: Edward Beloyianis was paralyzed at 14 as a result of a spinal operation at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center. He died eight years later of complications of the paralysis.
abstract: Bronx jury awards $45.6 million to parents of Edward Beloyianis, who was paralyzed at age 14 from waist down in November 2002 after undergoing surgery to correct scoliosis, and died eight years later due to complications of his paralysis; lawyer for his parents successfully argued that spinal operation at New York-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center was to blame.
